alert.note: Alert for Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 14 at 10:10AM PST until December 16 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING FOR TODAY IS CANCELLED... * CHANGES...Additional light snow showers are likely throughout the day into early evening, however the risk of heavy snows has ended for today. Expect slick roads going into the evening commute as temperatures drop, especially after sunset. * WHAT...Heavy snow possible with the next storm starting Wednesday afternoon. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, except 3 to 11 inches west of highway 395 possible. * WHERE...Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time.
